description: Redevelopment to provide a 'mews' of 7 (three storey) terraced houses (with basement and roof gardens) with integral parking and landscaping (following the demolition of existing residential building)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Detailed drawings at a scale of 1:20 and/or samples of the materials and/or manufacturers specifications to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details, prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved and shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans ref: 316/D08/01a dated 09/09/2007, details indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be constructed to the front (fronting The Grove) which shall ensure visibility splays of 1.5m by 1.5m and there are no obstructions to visibility above 0.6m at the vehicular access points, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and shall be permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and living conditions of neighbouring occupiers and the streetscene in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 8 'Safer Ealing' | The refuse/recycling storage indicated on plan ref: 316/D08/01a received 09/09/2007, shall be in place prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To provide adequate refuse/recycling facilities and to protect the living conditions of the occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 4 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | The cycle parking indicated on plan ref: 316/D08/01a received 09/09/2007, shall be installed prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to lifetime homes standards prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and thereafter retained, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) Note 7: Accessible Ealing. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted for approval including the noise exposure category and/or the BS4142 noise level and the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided. Such details as are approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 - Noise and Vibration. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plan ref: 316/D08/01a received 09/09/2007, details of hard and soft landscaping works, including the internal access road, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved. The approved landscape details shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained for the duration of the development.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and to identify and protect the trees to be retained on site, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | The development hereby approved shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design. These works shall be carried out prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in any of the walls or roof of the building permitted, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the privacy and living conditions of neighbouring residential occupiers in Craven Avenue in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E, F, G & H of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of the contamination, and the approved remedial works shall be implemented before building works commence in the interests of occupiers of neighbouring sites.  Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking shown on the approved plan ref: 316/D08/01a received 09/09/2007, shall be provided in the position indicated on the approved plan prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | No development shall take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safegaurd the special archaeological interest of the site in accordance with policy 4.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004)
